metadata.title: CVE-2016-10191 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in libavformat/rtmppkt.c in FFmpeg before2.8.10, 3.0.x before 3.0.5, 3.1.x before 3.1.6, and 3.2.x before 3.2.2allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging failure tocheck for RTMP packet size mismatches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.2-2
libav-tools - 7:3.2.2-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.2-2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.2-2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavformat57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavresample3 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavutil55 - 7:3.2.2-2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.2.2-2
libswresample2 - 7:3.2.2-2
libswscale4 - 7:3.2.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.2-2').
